details.description: In a surprising turn of events, Ubisoft has announced the shutdown of its free-to-play first-person shooter, XDefiant. The game, which was launched in May 2024, will see its servers go offline on June 3, 2025.

content.text: A Good Start

XDefiant initially showed great promise, breaking Ubisoft's internal records by surpassing five million players faster than any previous game. The game was praised for its fast-paced gameplay and unique factions, drawing comparisons to popular titles like Call of Duty.
The Decline

Despite its strong start, XDefiant struggled to maintain its player base. By October, rumors of a potential shutdown began to circulate, which were initially denied by Ubisoft. However, the game's player numbers continued to dwindle, leading to the difficult decision to discontinue the game.
Ubisoft In the Background

Although XDefiant was a huge success when it first launched, Ubisoft behind the scenes was struggling to make money and profit from their titles. As a result of this they had to lay off hundreds of employees.
The Impact on Ubisoft

The shutdown of XDefiant is part of a broader restructuring at Ubisoft, which includes the closure of its San Francisco and Osaka studios, affecting nearly 300 employees. Ubisoft's CEO, Yves Guillemot, acknowledged the challenges the company faces but expressed commitment to navigating these turbulent times and finding solutions to regain momentum.
Community Reaction

The announcement has left many fans disappointed. Players have taken to social media to express their sadness and frustration, with some even starting petitions to save the game. Despite the shutdown, Ubisoft has promised to release all planned content for Season 3 and provide refunds to players who made recent purchases.
FaQ About XDefiant
Although XDefiant will be shutting down, the servers will not go offline until June 3rd, 2025.
Refunds
Players who made any purchases within the last 30 days will recive a refund for their purchases. Anyone who bought the Ultimate Founders Addition will recive a full refund.
Rewards & Cosmetics
Ubisoft decided that because the game was going to shut down, players will be able to use any weapon cosmetic or any skins that were added in the game along with season 3 rewards.
Closed Registration

As of December 3, 2024 players will not be able to sign-up to play XDefiant. Players who already have the game owned on their account are able to download and install the game and play until June 3rd, 2025

details.description: Fortnite responds to the player base about the cheating problem.

content.text: Background Context

Cheating has been a persistent issue in online gaming, and Fortnite is no exception. To maintain the integrity of the game and provide a fair experience for all players, Epic Games has ramped up its efforts to combat cheating. This article explores the latest strategies and actions taken by Fortniteâ€™s developers to tackle this problem.
Fighting Back
Epic Games has been seeing the amount of cheater rising in count and has decided to roll out new measures.
Legal Actions

Epic Games has announced that it is intensifying its legal actions against both players who cheat and those who sell cheating tools. This move aims to cut off cheating at its source by targeting the creators and distributors of cheat software
Tournament Rules

To further discourage cheating, Fortnite has restructured its tournament rules. Players found teaming up with cheaters in tournaments will face a minimum 28-day competitive ban, which will increase with each subsequent violation. This rule applies to all team-based modes, ensuring that even those who indirectly benefit from cheating are held accountable.
Technical Measures

Epic Games continues to invest in new detection technologies to identify and prevent cheating in real-time2. These technical measures are constantly updated to stay ahead of new cheating methods, ensuring that the game remains fair and competitive.
Community Involvement

The Fortnite community plays a crucial role in the fight against cheating. By reporting suspicious behavior and staying vigilant, players help Epic Games identify and address cheating more effectively. The new rules also encourage players to be mindful of their teammates, as associating with cheaters can lead to penalties.

name: Black Ops 6 Season 01 Patch Notes Nov 19

details.description: First real article. This article is about everything new with the patch notes for Black Ops 6 on November 19, 2024.

content.text: On November 19th, 2024 the developers of Black Ops 6: Treyarch released a patch for BO6 regarding the UI and movement. The patch notes go as follows below for the article.

content.caption: Announcement image for the patch notes.

content.text: Below is the patch notes for November 19, 2024 updates will change.
Global
Legacy XP Tokens
Updated Black Ops 6 to support legacy XP token functionality
Gameplay
Updated Black Ops 6 to support legacy XP token functionality
Cosmetics
Addressed an issue where weapon sights would be misaligned with the Weaver Repairman Operator Skin equipped.
Movement
Reduced the minimum sprint time required to perform the following actions: dive-to-prone or slide.
Addressed an issue that could result in being unable to sprint when performing several actions within a short amount of time.
Multiplayer
Movement
Players will no longer be taken out of sprint when taking forward-facing bullet damage with a Melee weapon equipped.
Zombies
Maps
Terminus: Addressed an issue where zombies could spawn indefinitely.
Liberty Falls: Addressed an issue where players would not be removed from a Chopper Gunner when starting the Main Quest Final Encounter.
Directed Mode
Exfil will now be triggered at the fifth hour of a Directed Mode Match due to a performance issue.
GobbleGums
Addressed an issue that allowed GobbleGums to persist indefinitely.
